The most winter product: about the benefits of ginger

07 Nov 2019, 05:18





Ginger is considered one of the most popular foods in the cold season. In winter, it can save you from infections, depression and other diseases. More information about the benefits of ginger will tell MedicForum.

Useful properties of ginger
Firstly, ginger is useful for its rich composition. So, it has a lot of essential oil, vitamins, for example, C, A, B1, B2, salts of phosphorus, magnesium and calcium. There is a lot of iron, sodium, potassium, zinc. In addition, ginger contains essential amino acids, tryptophan, leucine, threonine and others.



In terms of benefits, ginger is comparable to one of the most healthy foods - garlic. Unlike the latter, it certainly has a more pleasant aroma. Ginger resists infectious diseases. It has everything you need to increase immunity. If you use ginger as an additive, then you can improve the digestive process, help increase appetite due to the production of gastric juice by the body. Ginger also normalizes blood circulation, promotes better tissue nutrition. Secondly, ginger has another benefit - it has a diaphoretic, expectorant, antiemetic effect. The product is recognized as one of the strongest painkillers in traditional medicine.



Thirdly, ginger has a positive effect on the respiratory system. If the spice is in the diet constantly, then the state of human health will improve significantly. To do this, it is enough to eat one teaspoon of grated ginger or juice before each meal. The latter is especially useful for sore throats. Fourth, ginger is useful for hypertensive patients, as it lowers blood pressure. Also, the body due to ginger is cleared of decay products in the process of metabolism. Fifth, spice is an excellent aphrodisiac. To bring passion back into relationships, it’s best to include ginger in your diet.



And finally, ginger is an excellent defender against cancer. Therefore, do not neglect the consumption of such a wonderful product for health.

Contraindications
But, like any product, ginger has a number of contraindications:




Acute inflammatory infectious diseases;
Ulcer, gastritis, colitis;
Hepatitis;
Allergic reactions;
High body temperature;
Bleeding
Late pregnancy and lactation.
